original_title: Sri Lanka power minister, India HC discuss energy partnerships
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Minister of Power and Energy Kanchana Wijesekera met the new High Commissioner of India to Sri Lanka Santosh Jha at the ministry on Wednesday (27).
“We discussed about the Energy sector partnerships between the two countries and the implementation plans of those projects identified by both countries,” Wijesekera said on x (twitter).
Sri Lanka’s government has prioritised regional energy integration with grid connectivity between Sri Lanka and India to be implemented by 2030.
Linking the India and Sri Lanka power grids had been discussed since the 1970s.

India’s Adani wind power project has been facing continuous delay in Sri Lanka as a Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee (CANC) has been raising many concerns over the project components. (Colombo/Dec28/2023)
